content.description: In the gas-phase reaction represented by the following equation, methane <math alttext="(C H 4)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>CH</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and water <math alttext="(H 2 O)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> are produced from carbon dioxide <math alttext="(C O 2)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and hydrogen <math alttext="(H 2)" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> at high temperature and pressure.
content.question: Based on the Lewis diagrams, which of the products is more soluble in ethanol (<math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>5</mn></msub><mi>OH</mi></math>) ?

choices.label: Methane, because it has more hydrogen atoms than water does, so it can form more hydrogen bonds with ethanol.
Methane, because it is a larger molecule than water, so its electron cloud is more polarizable.
Water, because water has a greater molar mass than methane does.
Water, because water molecules can form hydrogen bonds with ethanol molecules, but methane molecules cannot.

content.answer: Water, because water molecules can form hydrogen bonds with ethanol molecules, but methane molecules cannot.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
